data.title: ACUSON Sequoiaâ¢ Ultrasound System Contrast Enhanced Ultrasound Knobology
data.meta_description: This course demonstrates the use of the contrast feature on the ACUSON Sequoia ultrasound system with the VA11 software. .
data.text: Congratulations. You have completed the ACUSON Sequoia Contrast Enhanced Ultrasound Knobology course. Listed below are the key points that have been presented. Take time to review the material before you proceed to the final quiz. In this course you have learned to: Describe the contrast application features, options, and image optimization of the ACUSON Sequoia ultrasound system, âDiscuss the contrast application touch screen controls and functions, and Modify the contrast application configuration options. Use the selection below to learn more about the contrast enhanced ultrasound feature for the ACUSON Sequoia ultrasound system. ACUSON Sequoia CEUS Knobology ACUSON Sequoia CEUS Knobology. Instructions:Flash File:HTML5 File:/content/generator/Course_90022581/Sequoia_CEUS_Knobology_Global-V5/index.htmlPDF File: Please note that the learning material is for training purposes only! For the proper use of the software or hardware, please always use the Operator Manual or Instructions for Use (hereinafter collectively âOperator Manualâ) issued by Siemens Healthineers. This material is to be used as training material only and shall by no means substitute the Operator Manual. Any material used in this training will not be updated on a regular basis and does not necessarily reflect the latest version of the software and hardware available at the time of the training. The Operator Manual shall be used as your main reference, in particular for relevant safety information like warnings and cautions. Note: Some functions shown in this material are optional and might not be part of your system. The information in this material contains general technical descriptions of specifications and options as well as standard and optional features that do not always have to be present in individual cases. Certain products, product related claims or functionalities described in the material (hereinafter collectively âFunctionalityâ) may not (yet) be commercially available in your country. Due to regulatory requirements, the future availability of said Functionalities in any specific country is not guaranteed. Please contact your local Siemens Healthineers sales representative for the most current information. The reproduction, transmission or distribution of this training or its contents is not permitted without express written authority. Offenders will be liable for damages. All names and data of patients, parameters and configuration dependent designations are fictional and examples only. ACUSON Sequoia is as trademark of Siemens Medical Solutions USA, Inc. All rights, including rights created by patent grant or registration of a utility model or design, are reserved. Copyright Â© Siemens Healthcare GmbH, 2020. Selecting the âº continues this course and confirms you have read and understand this disclaimer. Welcome to the ACUSON Sequoia contrast enhanced ultrasound advanced application tutorial. This tutorial will cover the activation and usage of the contrast application. The ACUSON Sequoia ultrasound system was designed to provide ultrasound users with detailed and information-rich images that dramatically improve the way ultrasound is performed today. For CEUS, that means overcoming the technical barriers that are unique to this advanced application. The ACUSON Sequoia system has accomplished this feat by being built with enormous architectural power. This power, using InTuneâ¢ pulse formation, can provide visualization of contrast deeper, and with greater clarity, than even the original ACUSON Sequoia S512 ultrasound system. Prior to the start of this course, you should review the ACUSON Sequoia ultrasound system Major Modes tutorial and be familiar with the terms and functions associated with the ACUSON Sequoia system. Upon successful completion of this course you will be able to: Describe the contrast application features, options, and image optimization of the ACUSON Sequoia ultrasound system Discuss the contrast application touch screen controls and functions Modify the contrast application configuration options This module will familiarize you with this interactive training tool.
